title: When was the Columbian Exchange? - Quora

response.answer_text: Columbian Exchange ( also known as Columbian interchange), the name was created by Christopher Columbus. The Columbian Exchange was developed in the 15th and 16th centuries, in what was called the Old World ( America's, and West Africa). It was a swap of ideas and knowledge, which included, transfer of animals, culture, paper, humans, technology and unfortunately diseases.
